intro: Thesium graecum, commonly known as the Greek thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Xanthorrhoeaceae family, which includes plants known for their showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its upright, branching structure. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Thesium graecum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands.
